29.20.text:
Hello. Too late now to wish they'd
applied for Pointless,

32.76.text:
instead, two more teams of students
are about to tackle several dozen

36.92.text:
general knowledge questions in full
view of an expectant nation,

40.84.text:
with the chance to do it
all over again in the second round

43.56.text:
for the winners.
We might see tonight's losers again,

46.12.text:
if they're among the four
highest-scoring losing teams

51.20.text:
Now, Oxford Brookes University began
life in the 19th century

54.32.text:
as a one-room art school
in the city centre.

57.52.text:
The artist and author
John Henry Brookes became

63.24.text:
and was a powerful influence on its
development over the next 30 years.

69.84.text:
and it took its present form
as a university in 1992.

73.60.text:
Alumni include the politicians Lynne
Featherstone and Jonathan Djanogly,

77.60.text:
and the double-Olympic rowing
gold medallist, Steve Williams.

81.24.text:
With an average age of 36 and
representing around 17,000 students,

85.96.text: let's meet the Oxford Brookes team.

88.52.text:
Hello, I'm Inigo Purcell, I'm
from Chiswick in west London,

92.12.text:
and I'm a third-year English
literature student.

95.08.text:
Hello, I'm Pat O'Shea, I live
in Oxford and I'm studying film.

100.96.text:
Guten Tag, hoeijendagh,
bonjour - I'm Thomas De Bock,

103.16.text:
I'm from Liege in Belgium, and
I study motorsport engineering.

106.96.text:
Hi, I'm Emma-Ben Lewis, I'm
originally from Woodford Green in

110.28.text:
north-east London, and I'm studying
for a Master's in psychology.

118.36.text:
Now, the Courtauld Institute of Art
owes its foundation

121.44.text:
to a number of art collectors
in the 1930s,

123.76.text:
among them the textile magnate,
Samuel Courtauld,

126.40.text:
who leant the Institute both his
name and the bulk of its funding.

131.04.text:
And it now occupies
a corner of Somerset House

135.64.text:
The spy Anthony Blunt was
its director from 1947 until 1974,

139.72.text:
where he taught the late
Brian Sewell.

142.04.text:
Andrew Graham-Dixon studied there,
as did the actor Vincent Price,

145.52.text:
the former director of the
British Museum, Neil MacGregor,

148.60.text:
and the former director of the Tate,
Nicholas Serota.

151.48.text:
With an average age of 23
and representing only 460 students,

156.28.text: let's meet some of the current lot.

158.84.text:
Hi, I'm Ty Vanover
I'm from Clintwood, Virginia,

161.08.text:
and I'm studying for an MA
in 19th-century art.

165.04.text:
Hi, I'm Margaret-Anne Logan
from Patchogue, New York,

167.48.text:
and I'm studying for an MA
in 18th-century French art.

172.24.text:
Hello, I'm Harvey Shepherd, I'm from
Chesterfield in north Derbyshire,

175.76.text:
and I'm studying for a BA
in the history of art.

177.84.text:
Hello, I'm Jack Snape,
I'm from Bolton and I'm studying

180.76.text:
for a Master's degree in the
conservation of wall paintings.

they have to be

here's the first starter for ten -

of those paintings, I think.
